founders.name: Ankur Nagpal
founders.bio_summary: Built the first version in 2013 to sell his own marketing courses and grew Fedora into Teachable as the core founder.

founders.name: Conrad Wadowski
founders.bio_summary: Early customer and advisor who joined as a full-time co-founder during the 2014 rebuild of Teachable (then Fedora).

category: Creator-led online course and digital product platform
product_summary: Platform for creators to build and sell courses, coaching, digital downloads, memberships, and community spaces with integrated payments, analytics, AI tools, and mobile learning support.
pricing: Black Friday 2025 promo: Builder $29/mo for 3 months then $89/mo; Growth $63/mo then $189/mo; Advanced $133/mo then $399/mo. Annual billing: Builder $69/mo, Growth $139/mo, Advanced $309/mo (billed yearly). 7-day free trial available.

core_problem.statement: Existing course platforms limited ownership and customization; Teachable was created so creators could fully own content, branding, and customer relationships.

competition.name: Thinkific
competition.reason_compared: Direct competitor providing an online course platform for creators.

competition.name: Kajabi
competition.reason_compared: All-in-one digital product and membership platform used by similar creator audiences.

competition.name: Podia
competition.reason_compared: Another creator-focused platform for courses, downloads, and memberships.

user_validation.detail: 150,000+ creators and businesses trust Teachable (company disclosure).

market_background.insight: Company-reported scale shows creator-led education serving 200K+ creators and 21M+ consumers across Teachable and Hotmart, indicating sizable demand for owned course platforms.

sources.note: Official about page with founding story and metrics (200K+ creators, $10B+ earnings, 30M+ products sold).
Public company profile listing founded year (2014), HQ New York, company size 51-200, and 150k+ creator count.
Founder Ankur Nagpal recounts building the first product in 2013, bringing on Conrad Wadowski, and rebranding Fedora to Teachable.
